hedline.hl1: AT&T TO OFFER AD-SUBSIDIZED WEB ACCESS

abstract.p: AT&T Corp will start advertising-subsidized Internet access service to match free offerings from competitors like NetZero (S)

block.p: AT&T said yesterday that it would start an advertising-subsidized Internet access service to match free offerings from competitors like NetZero. Users of the AT&T service, which will cost $4.95 a month, will be required to register and will be assigned an anonymous identification number that will allow tracking of the Web sites they visit. The service will display advertisements in a narrow window that users will not be able to remove from their screens.
